sources.autograph: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.604. 'Mese di Maggio 1795. Quartetto per due violini, viola, e violoncello di Luigi Bocchcrini, compositor di camera di S.M. il Re di Prussia'.
sources.ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.605. Copy made in Berlin for Frederick William II.
sources.first_edition: 1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 39 no. 4 (Book 2 no. 1; for title and comment, see No. 234).

continues_from_previous.notes: The whole of the above movement is also used by Boccherini himself(?), in the quartet Op. 54 no. 3 (No. 252).
continues_from_previous.arrangements: Of the first movement, as part of a quartet (no. 1) for clarinet, flute, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Brock, c. 1810 (see No. 262).
